description: Expert: TVN and Polsat's inclusion on the list of strategic companies may result in lawsuits

title: Are you a homeowner? Find out how to avoid tax traps!
description: Owning a flat is not only an investment, but also a responsibility associated with many tax obligations. Failure to comply with the regulations or lack of knowledge in this area can lead to unpleasant consequences, such as high financial penalties. It is therefore worth knowing the most important legal aspects regarding taxes related to owning a property and learning how to avoid potential problems.

title: ZUS sends decisions to parents. They will have to return the money
description: The Social Insurance Institution has introduced the "Active Parent" program, offering financial support to parents of children aged 12-35 months. However, some families receive letters from ZUS demanding a refund. Check what rules apply to avoid financial problems.

title: Trzaskowski or Nawrocki? A sudden turn in the latest poll
description: If the presidential elections were held next Sunday, Rafał Trzaskowski and Karol Nawrocki would meet in the second round - according to a survey conducted by the Pollster Research Institute on behalf of "Super Express". The advantage of the Civic Coalition candidate over his competitors has significantly increased compared to the last United Surveys survey.

title: Does Your Name Start With "R" Or "S"? Is This The Future That Awaits You?
description: The first letter of our name reflects our character, personality and also our future. A bit like in horoscopes or numerological predictions. This time we will take the letters "R" and "S" to the so-called workshop. See what you are like and what the future holds for you.

title: A Pole won a fortune in Eurojackpot. Where did he buy his lucky ticket?
description: In the Saint Nicholas Eurojackpot draw, which took place on December 6, one of the main prizes was won by a Pole. Only now has it been revealed where the lucky winner from our country lives and where he bought the ticket that gave him PLN 2 million.

title: Jerzy Brzęczek may return to Ekstraklasa. Two clubs are considering hiring him
description: Jerzy Brzęczek has been unemployed since October 2022. However, this may change in the near future. The former coach of the Polish national football team has found himself on the radar of two clubs in our Ekstraklasa.

title: The End of Traditional School Assessments? The Ministry of National Education is Preparing a Revolution in the Assessment System
description: The grading system in Polish schools has long been controversial, and the pressure to achieve high grades can negatively affect students' well-being and self-confidence. As reported by Wyborcza.pl, the Ministry of National Education (MEN) plans to start a discussion on the method of grading in the Polish education system, engaging teachers and school principals in developing the best solutions.

title: Higher ZUS contributions for entrepreneurs from 2025. For some people, the increase will be as much as PLN 875 per year
description: At the beginning of 2025, entrepreneurs conducting business in Poland will be burdened with increased social insurance contributions, which will translate into higher costs of running a business. These changes may be particularly painful for entrepreneurs using preferential tax rules, such as "small ZUS". Here are the details.

title: What Happened Before Rosemary's Baby? A Surprising Return to a Horror Masterpiece
description: A brand new horror film, "Apartment 7A," will be available on one of Poland's popular streaming platforms in December. It's a prequel to Roman Polanski's cult classic "Rosemary's Baby" from 1968, based on Ira Levin's most famous horror novel. When and where will you be able to watch the new film?

title: Legia Warsaw - Lugano. What time is the Conference League match, where to watch?
description: Legia Warsaw will host FC Lugano in the 5th round of the Conference League at the Łazienkowska stadium. The match is scheduled to start at 6:45 p.m. The match will be broadcast on Polsat Sport 1, Polsat Sport Premium 1 and on Polsat Box Go.

title: Tusk's government's decision on TVN. US ambassador responds
description: TVN and Polsat will be added to the list of protected companies. This is Donald Tusk's reaction to rumors about the alleged sale of the TVN station to a Hungarian fund linked to Viktor Orban. The US ambassador commented on the prime minister's announcement.

title: Developer Sentiment Index at record low. More and more companies expect housing prices to fall
description: Neither developers nor their clients expect housing price increases today - according to the latest housing market sentiment survey conducted by the service Tabelaofert.pl. More and more development companies, however, expect prices to fall in the next six months.

title: Effects of the Collegium Humanum scandal. It will be harder to get positions in state-owned companies
description: Stricter criteria for candidates for members of supervisory boards of state-owned companies and limiting the possibility of using an MBA diploma to get into the supervisory bodies of state-owned companies - these are the changes planned by the Ministry of State Assets described on Thursday on the Business Insider Polska website

title: This product went up in price more than butter in November. Double-digit price increases
description: In November, everyday shopping in stores grew by 5.5 percent year-on-year - according to the "Retail Price Index" report. Vegetables saw the biggest price increases - by 16.6 percent year-on-year, and pet food the least - by 0.2 percent year-on-year - it added.

title: President of the National Health Fund: Medical personnel have started to be paid decently. The health insurance contribution does not keep up with the minimum wage in the sector
description: The growth in revenues from health insurance contributions does not keep up with the introduced mechanism for increasing salaries in health care. It seems, therefore, that it is worth considering determining the pace of this growth - said Filip Nowak, president of the National Health Fund, in an interview for "DGP".

title: Police Want Black Powder Weapons to Be Controlled. Expert: The Problem Doesn't Exist
description: According to former policeman and shooting instructor Andrzej Idzikowski, the problem with the use of weapons in Poland is "at the level of being struck by lightning", i.e. very rare.

title: SOKiK dismissed Allegro's appeal against a fine totaling PLN 3.97 million
description: The Court of Competition and Consumer Protection upheld in its entirety the decision of the Office of Competition and Consumer Protection imposing a fine on Allegro in the total amount of PLN 3.97 million for the use of prohibited contractual provisions in its regulations - Allegro informed in a press release.

title: Late phone bill is the norm. Poles' debts reach PLN 1.5 billion
description: According to Thursday's BIG InfoMonitor report, the total debt of individuals and companies to the telecommunications industry amounted to PLN 1.5 billion in October this year. 316 thousand entities had debt to enterprises from this sector, and the average debt was over PLN 4.7 thousand.

title: President Jun: I was defending the nation by declaring martial law. This is not a coup
description: South Korean President Jun Suk-jeol said Thursday he declared martial law last week to defend the constitutional order, denying accusations of a coup. An opposition party plans to put an impeachment motion to a vote next Saturday.

title: Pharmacists do not want to be on duty at night and on holidays. Changing regulations did not help
description: After almost a year of the regulations providing for paying pharmacies for on-duty shifts being in force, almost half of the counties authorized to do so have still not adopted the required resolutions - reports "Dziennik Gazeta Prawna" in its Thursday edition.

title: LPP expects revenues of approximately PLN 26 billion in 2025, with a margin of 52-53 percent.
description: The LPP Group expects revenues of approximately PLN 26 billion in the 2025 financial year, with a gross sales margin of 52-53 percent, the company reported in its quarterly report.

title: FBI Director to Leave at End of Biden's Term to Avoid Conflict with Trump
description: The director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Christopher Wray, has announced that he will resign at the end of the current administration's term, the New York Times and Fox News reported on Wednesday. Wray announced that he would be leaving three years before the end of his own term to avoid conflict with Donald Trump.

title: Donald Tusk summed up the first year of government. "We know what the priorities are
description: Exactly one year ago I delivered an exposé on behalf of your government," Prime Minister Donald Tusk wrote on Twitter. He added a short recording summarizing a year of his cabinet's activities.

title: Warsaw. Skanska sold P180 office building for EUR 100 million
description: The 15-story office building near the Wilanowska metro station was purchased by Investika Real Estate Fund and Bud Holdings.

title: On the Silk Road, Russia gives in to pressure from China
description: Chinese suppliers report that Russia will soon ease restrictions on rail transit from China to Europe.

title: Barbara Nowacka revealed the inside story of talks with the Episcopate about religious education classes. "A desperate cry of helplessness
description: - Part of the Episcopate is entering a political clash. The very sharpened tone coincides with the campaign. Some have simply signed the Church up to PiS - believes Barbara Nowacka, Minister of National Education. She responded in this way to the statement on religious education in schools. As she added, "not everyone looks at it calmly".

title: Responsible Innovation: How Smart Will the “Smart” Village Be?
description: “Smart” transformation is no longer limited to cities. Digital solutions are becoming increasingly common in rural areas, helping, for example, to run a farm - writes Dominik Zieliński, Łukasiewicz Research Network - ITECH Institute of Innovation and Technology.

title: The Zloty is on the attack again
description: Thursday on the currency market will be marked by decisions from central banks. How will the złoty react to them?

title: Donald Tusk summed up the first year of government. "We know what the priorities are
description: Exactly one year ago I delivered an exposé on behalf of your government," Prime Minister Donald Tusk wrote on Twitter. He added a short recording summarizing a year of his cabinet's activities.

title: Death of little Sara. There is a verdict for the father and stepmother
description: The father and stepmother of 10-year-old Sara Sharif were found guilty of her murder by a London court on Wednesday, saying they subjected her to “terrible suffering” for more than two years.

title: Jacek Nizinkiewicz: PiS will not end up like SLD. Settlements will not ruin Kaczyński
description: Before taking power, Donald Tusk promised to hold PiS governments to account. He has not kept his word for a year. If this continues, Poles may doubt the effectiveness of the current government and question the scandals of the previous one. And those who do not hold themselves accountable will be held accountable.

title: Secrets of Prehistoric Mars: New Discovery About Water on the Red Planet
description: Scientists have studied the structure of zircon in a meteorite found in the Sahara in 2011. The results of the analysis may confirm the theory of the presence of hot water sources on the surface of prehistoric Mars.

title: Podcast "Twój Biznes": Polish stock market - optimistic forecasts for 2025
description: It's Thursday, December 12, and in today's episode of "Twój Biznes" Bartłomiej Kawałek analyzes key economic issues.

title: ONLY WITH US. PiS President on "problems" with his cats
SURVEY. A heavy blow to Tusk! Poles negatively evaluate the government
description: The newspaper reports that 30 percent assess Donald Tusk's government "negatively" and 21.5 percent "definitely negatively.

description: Activists from the "Last Generation" are paralyzing Warsaw with impunity.

title: Tusk explains his "protection" of TVN. Strong responses
description: You are operating as if in Putin's satrapy - emphasized PiS MP Sebastian Kaleta.

title: The Snowflake Generation and the Secret Services
description: Recently, the British counterintelligence service MI5 made an unprecedented decision to launch a social media campaign aimed at persuading young people to join the secret services.

title: Marcin Romanowski's case. There is a request to issue an arrest warrant
description: Police officers from the Warsaw Police Headquarters have filed a motion with the National Prosecutor's Office to issue an arrest warrant against former Deputy Minister of Justice Marcin Romanowski - informed on Thursday morning the press spokesman for the Ministry of Interior and Administration, Jacek Dobrzyński.

title: Prime Minister Donald Tusk summed up the year of his government. He took a dig at PiS politicians
description: The first year of Donald Tusk's coalition government is coming to an end. On this occasion, the achievements of the cabinet were praised, including the payment of 800 plus, 1500 PLN for grandmothers and the unblocking of funds from the KPO. The Prime Minister also addressed the opposition. I wish PiS politicians, who a year ago, after the establishment of our government, suddenly felt worse, health with all my heart. To everyone, not only the suspects - wrote Tusk.

title: Confusion over subsidies. "PiS has fallen into its own trap
description: - Law and Justice brewed this beer itself and must drink it - said Dariusz Klimczak in the Graffiti program. The Minister of Infrastructure commented with these words on the decision of one of the Supreme Court chambers, which on Wednesday recognized PiS's complaint against the August decision of the National Electoral Commission to punish the party for improper financing of the 2023 campaign.

title: Innovative surgery in a Łódź hospital. She regained her hearing after 40 years
description: - It was awful, but now it's great. Before, I couldn't hear at all in that ear, and after this implant, my life is completely different - revealed 67-year-old Regina Chłopecka. The woman underwent an innovative procedure in a hospital in Łódź and after 40 years, she regained her hearing. The 67-year-old was the first patient to undergo the procedure in the Łódź facility, but not the last, because the list of willing patients is only getting longer.

title: These Christmas Eve dishes will definitely be on the table, but are they safe for children?
description: As every year, Christmas Eve will be associated with warm family gatherings at a lavishly laid table. In accordance with tradition, the supper will include borscht with dumplings, fish, pierogi and holiday sweets. When preparing the menu, it is worth thinking about children. Not all delicacies are recommended for the youngest guests.

description: Donald Trump has invited Xi Jinping to his inauguration, according to US media. The Chinese leader is not the only person invited - Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban was also among them. Although inviting foreign leaders to a presidential inauguration is not a tradition, the future White House spokeswoman pointed out that world leaders are lining up.

The court decided to temporarily arrest the former deputy minister, and the police have been looking for him since Tuesday. The

title: Mysterious Drones Circling Over US Pentagon: They Didn't Come From Iranian Mothership
description: The mysterious drones appearing in the airspace over New Jersey on the US east coast are not being launched from an Iranian ship, the Pentagon has said. This claim was made by Republican congressman Jeff Van Drew. American authorities admit, however, that the origin of these drones is still being determined.

title: This is the penultimate such opportunity this year.
description: In the coming days, it is worth gazing at the sky. The Geminid meteor shower will peak on the night from Friday to Saturday. However, the bright full moon may interfere with our observations.

title: 350 km/h train to Warsaw? CPK applies for environmental decision
description: The Central Communication Port company has submitted an application for a decision on environmental conditions for a section of the Pleszew–Poznań railway line. This is part of the “Y”, or the High Speed ​​​​Rail line, which is to connect Warsaw, Poznań and Wrocław. The permissible train speed on this section is to be as much as 350 km/h. This is the first application for a decision on environmental conditions submitted for a railway line with such a speed.

title: My God, the light." Assad prisoner hugs journalist
description: A CNN reporter witnessed Syrian rebels opening the cells of one of the regime's prisons where opponents of Bashar al-Assad were being held. "My God, the light," said one prisoner, who saw the sun for the first time in days. The top commander of the rebels who seized power in Syria has vowed to prosecute anyone involved in torturing or killing detainees.

title: Trump Threatened Him With Jail. Now Zuckerberg Gives Him Money
description: Meta Platforms has donated $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration fund, The Wall Street Journal notes, in another move by CEO Mark Zuckerberg to improve relations with the new president. Just a few months ago, Trump threatened to put him in jail if the Facebook owner “interfered in the election.”

title: She ignored the "stopper" and pedestrians. That's how she "earned" 47 penalty points. Recording
description: The police from Otwock had no doubts, imposing 47 penalty points on the 38-year-old. The woman caused a hazard in road traffic, did not have a seat belt fastened, used a mobile phone and ignored a man who was helping children across the road. The situation was recorded by a surveillance camera.

title: It was the first time we saw so much water. It was surprising.
description: Tourists can once again admire the famous Iguazu Falls in Brazil up close. Due to recent downpours and an exceptionally high flow, the footbridge over the falls had to be closed.

title: Closed section of provincial road. Spilled substance. "It's mud and clay
description: In Marki near Warsaw, on provincial road number 631, a spilled substance is blocking traffic. Initially, it was reported that it was concrete, then it was clarified that it was "mud and clay". Services are directing people to detours.

title: Trump's Surprising Inauguration Plans: First Names Are Here
description: Donald Trump has invited Chinese leader Xi Jinping to the inauguration of his presidency in Washington, the American television station CBS News reported on Wednesday. It is possible that Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will also be among the president-elect's guests.

title: Butter isn't the only thing getting more expensive. Double-digit price increases for some products
description: In November, everyday purchases in stores grew by 5.5 percent year-on-year, according to the "Retail Price Index" report. Vegetables rose the most - by 16.6 percent, and pet food the least - by 0.2 percent.

title: Nowacka: part of the episcopate is entering a political clash
description: I have the feeling that at least part of the episcopate is entering a political clash - said Barbara Nowacka in "Rozmowa Piaseckiego" by the Minister of Education, referring to the recent talks about one religion lesson per week. - During the talks, they put forward proposals that are simply unacceptable to anyone, because they are a bit of a desperate cry of helplessness - she added.

title: There is a chance" in the case of Hamas hostages
description: Israel's Defense Ministry reported that Israel Kac spoke with Lloyd Austin. During the conversation, the Israeli Defense Minister reportedly told his counterpart that "there is a chance for a new agreement and the return of hostages" kidnapped by Hamas in October 2023.

title: He was in a hurry to get to the market, he wanted to settle the matter "quietly", without a ticket.
description: Police officers from Mogilno (Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship) stopped a 21-year-old driver from Bulgaria who exceeded the speed limit in a built-up area and tried to give them two thousand zlotys in exchange for refraining from doing so.

title: He introduced martial law, he explains why. "I will not surrender
description: South Korean President Jun Suk Jeol defended his decision to declare martial law on Thursday, saying in a televised speech that he wanted to "prevent the collapse of democracy and stop the opposition's parliamentary dictatorship." He also announced that he would not resign.

title: Ma'am, who is this child?" Grandma's mistake and panic at school
description: In Udine, in northern Italy, a grandmother picked up a strange child from primary school instead of her own, and then took him to a soccer school. "I was fooled by the boy's hood," she explained.

title: He grabbed the door handles of apartments and stole a purse from one of them.
description: In Warsaw's Śródmieście district, a 27-year-old entered the stairwells and grabbed the door handles of every apartment. From one, he stole a purse containing a mobile phone and money. The man had been convicted of theft in the past.

title: Chocolate Advent Calendars Sold at a Well-Known Chain Have Been Withdrawn
description: The Chief Sanitary Inspector announced the withdrawal of several batches of Advent calendars from sale. The reason is the "incorrect taste and smell of the chocolates contained in them". They were sold in Lidl chain stores.

title: Be especially careful
description: In the Tatras and Karkonosze, the first level of avalanche danger is in effect, and the trails are dangerously slippery. The services remind about the safety rules during mountain hikes.

title: Sara suffered terribly before her death. Her father and stepmother are to blame.
description: A London court has found that 10-year-old Sarah Sharif was murdered by her father and stepmother. The crime in August 2023 shocked the British public. The investigation showed that the girl had been brutally abused before the murder.

title: There is a request for an arrest warrant for Marcin Romanowski
description: The Warsaw Police Headquarters has filed an application for an arrest warrant for former Deputy Minister of Justice Marcin Romanowski - informs an RMF FM reporter.

title: Śliwka: If the National Electoral Commission does not want to break the law, it should pass a resolution and award funds to PiS

title: Radio 357 journalist will continue to comment on Formula 1
description: Michał Gąsiorowski will be commentating on Formula 1 races on Eleven Sports (Cyfrowy Polsat group). He previously worked in this role with Eleven Sports, and has been co-creating the Internet Radio 357 for several years.

title: Ewa Wrzosek recalled from delegation to Ministry of Justice. Bodnar criticized in the background
description: Prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek criticized Prosecutor General Adam Bodnar for his insufficiently decisive actions in reforming the justice system and resigned from her functions.

title: In the TVN case, PiS dressed up in a chasuble and rings the bell with its tail
description: The fact that PiS politicians are signing up to the plan to take over TVN by Orbán's Hungary is a clear testimony to them. It's good that Tusk nipped it in the bud.

title: Spokesperson of the Ministry of Interior and Administration: The police have requested the issuance of an arrest warrant for Marcin Romanowski
description: The Warsaw Police Headquarters has filed a motion with the National Prosecutor's Office to issue an arrest warrant against former Deputy Minister of Justice Marcin Romanowski, the spokesman for the Ministry of Interior and Administration, Jacek Dobrzyński, informed on Thursday.

title: Putin wants to negotiate? "He has to win somewhere
description: Volodymyr Zelensky's latest statements suggest that he is ready to talk to Russia, according to The Wall Street Journal. According to the newspaper, Zelensky's rhetoric reflects the growing fatigue of Ukrainians who want to end the war, while major Western capitals, including Washington and Berlin, are still reluctant to accelerate integration with NATO. On the WP's "Newsroom" program, former Polish ambassador to Ukraine Jan Piekło was asked whether negotiations between Russia and Ukraine could

title: We've been waiting for this kind of news. There's a chance for a white Christmas
description: The weather is - as we know - changeable. This time, those who dream of a white Christmas will be pleased with the change in forecasts. - Two days ago, the holiday days were supposed to be warm. And today, these models show a different scenario - explains Grzegorz Walijewski from IMGW in an interview with WP. And he says what all children and even some adults are waiting for: there is a chance that it will snow on Christmas Eve.

title: Prosecutor enters a company from the sanctions list. "A loss of great value
description: The prosecutor's office has opened an investigation into fraud of great value in a company that the government took from Russian oligarchs - Wirtualna Polska has learned. The notification was filed by the compulsory administrator. This is the result of an audit of the activities of his predecessor appointed by the PiS government. Our findings indicate that this concerns the expenditure of over one million PLN on software that has not been implemented in the company to this day.

title: Drone attack in Grozny. Kadyrov vows retaliation
description: Ukrainian drones attacked the barracks of the Interior Ministry's special regiment in the Chechen capital, Grozny. Ramzan Kadyrov responded to the events by announcing retaliation.

title: Problem with Romanowski's arrest. A wave of comments. "Hide and seek
description: The police have filed for the issuance of an arrest warrant for former Deputy Minister of Justice Marcin Romanowski. Despite the decision to arrest the politician, the MP has not reported to the police station, and officers cannot find him. "He is so sick, but he has the strength to play hide and seek," assessed Deputy Minister Arkadiusz Myrcha.

title: Will soldiers be allowed to shoot at the border? Konfederacja will submit a bill
description: The fall of the Syrian regime has caused euphoria in society. Many Syrians began returning to the country a few hours after the fall of the regime. Unofficially, it is said that the European Union wants to suspend asylum law in connection with the situation in Syria. - I do not share the enthusiasm of many people from the liberal elites that the overthrow of Assad will bring some stability to the Middle East, quite the opposite - assessed Michał Wawer, Confederation MP, in the "Tłit" WP program.

title: Assad's presidential palace. There is a Polish thread
description: The residence of Bashar al-Assad, abandoned last week by the overthrown and exiled Syrian dictator, is a palace built on Mount Mezzeh. It is one of the most recognizable buildings in Syria. Its monumental structure towers over the city. The building is the work of Polish architect Wojciech Zabłocki.

title: Wrzosek criticized Bodnar. "There is one advantage that she lost her function
description: Ewa Wrzosek criticized the Minister of Justice Adam Bodnar on TVP. She admitted that Roman Giertych would have been a better Minister of Justice. She also said that "these are not the times to strictly adhere to the letter of the law". A moment later, she was recalled from a delegation to the Ministry of Justice and the National Council of Prosecutors at the Prosecutor General. - Wrzosek is incredible and in this whole scandal about criticizing Adam Bodnar, this is one plus that she lost her fun

title: The End of Grades as We Know Them? MEN Is Preparing a Revolution
description: The Ministry of Education is preparing to revolutionize the way students' progress is recorded in school. The ministry wants to decide whether current grades during the semester should be digital or descriptive. Teachers will be asked for their opinion.

title: The atmospheric river carries storms and downpours
description: Residents of the eastern United States are struggling with heavy rain and strong winds. Tens of thousands of homes have been left without power. The wind has blown down trees, and forecasters are also warning of flooding and undertow.

title: Why is there an arrest warrant for Marcin Romanowski? The spokesman for the Ministry of Interior and Administration explains
description: TVN24 learned on Thursday morning that an arrest warrant may be issued for Marcin Romanowski. The information was later confirmed by the spokesman for the Ministry of Interior and Administration, Jacek Dobrzyński. "Police officers from the Warsaw Police Headquarters have filed a motion with the National Prosecutor's Office to issue an arrest warrant," Dobrzyński said. The court decided to temporarily arrest the former deputy minister, and the police have been looking for him since Tuesday. The p

title: He drove on drugs and hit a 10-year-old. The child died. There is a verdict
description: A Gorzów court sentenced the perpetrator of an accident in Wawrów (Lubuskie) in which a 10-year-old boy died to 12 years in prison. As experts determined, Krzysztof P. was driving too fast, and during the investigation he admitted that he had been taking drugs on the day of the accident. The verdict is not final.

title: Bottle of vodka stolen, security guards stabbed
description: The 28-year-old tried to steal a bottle of vodka from a store, and when the security guards responded, he became aggressive and attacked them with a knife. His friends tried to help him. The police detained four Georgians, all of whom were charged.

title: Selena Gomez Engaged: "Forever Starts Now
description: Selena Gomez is engaged to music producer and songwriter Benny Blanco. The popular singer and actress announced it herself, on social media.

title: Missing man dead, body buried. Crime suspect found in prison
description: A 40-year-old man is facing a life sentence for strangling his friend and burying his body. The crime took place in September in Krapkowice in the Opole region. The man pleaded guilty. He was charged with murder.

title: He choked an elderly woman and set her house on fire, she died in the flames. He never admitted guilt
description: The man, now 42, beat and choked an 82-year-old woman in 2006. Then he burned down her house, and she died in the fire. He claims he is innocent. And his blood ended up on her clothes because he was saving the elderly woman after an accident. The court did not believe him.

title: He overtook and went "to the front". Recording
description: The camera captured the driver's reckless driving and overtaking "head-on" near Inowrocław (Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship). The recording was sent to the police, who are establishing the driver's identity. He faces a fine of up to five thousand złoty, and if the case goes to court, the fine could be as much as thirty thousand złoty.

title: 55 bus lines in counties and 110 communes. This was announced by the Marshal of Małopolska
description: The Marshal of the Małopolska Province, Łukasz Smółka, announced that 55 bus lines will be created in 2025, covering all counties in the province and 110 communes. They will be launched by the Małopolska Feeder Lines, owned by the local government carrier Koleje Małopolskie.

title: The European Court of Justice issued an important judgment for Getin Noble Bank customers
description: The Court of Justice of the European Union has clarified the provisions on the independence of the national resolution authority and complaints about its decisions concerning financial institutions on the verge of bankruptcy. These are answers to questions from the Provincial Administrative Court in Warsaw, where thousands of borrower cases are pending. As Maciej Sokołowski, TVN24 correspondent in Brussels, comments, "there are no clear indications here whether the decisions concerning Getin Ban

title: Wrzosek: the determination to introduce changes in the prosecutor's office has decreased
description: Prosecutor Ewa Wrzosek assessed that Roman Giertych would be a better minister of justice than Adam Bodnar. She explained her statement on TOK FM radio. She said that she meant "practical knowledge of the functioning of aspects of the prosecutor's office" and "determination to carry out a thorough reform".

title: Macierewicz has 31 penalty points and can still drive a car
description: - MP Antoni Macierewicz could legally drive a car on Tuesday, December 10 and will be able to do so for another week - confirms the former deputy head of the capital city traffic police, Wojciech Pasieczny. But how is that possible, since he already had 31 penalty points on November 20, and a driving license is lost after 24 points? So when will he finally lose it?

title: One in 20 deaths in Canada is the result of medical assistance in dying.
description: Already one in 20 deaths in Canada is the result of medical assistance in dying (MAID). It has been legal there for over 8 years. The number of people using euthanasia and assisted dying is growing every year. These are usually terminally ill people, most often struggling with cancer.

title: Police, open up!" They didn't open up. The hammer was used
description: Gorzów police entered a "gambling den". In the premises, which they had to gain access to by force, they secured nine devices. Two people were detained.

title: PiS politicians: Tusk's government "reaches into drivers' pockets". How they manipulate
description: PiS politicians are now accusing the government of "reaching into drivers' pockets again" because it is increasing the fuel fee. They do not add that the Minister of Infrastructure of the United Right government did the same - because everything is simply decided by the inflation rate. In addition, it does not have to affect petrol prices.

title: This is the biggest reduction in 10 years. Good news for Swiss franc borrowers
description: Good news for Swiss franc borrowers. The Swiss National Bank (SNB) has cut interest rates by 50 basis points, the bank said in a statement on Thursday. After the biggest cut in 10 years, the main rate now stands at 0.50 percent.

title: They found fentanyl in the bodies of dolphins
description: Scientists studying dolphins in the Gulf of Mexico have found fentanyl in the bodies of these mammals, an opioid painkiller 100 times more potent than morphine. The researchers point out the negative impact that the presence of such drugs can have on ecosystems.

title: Zero Percent Credit. The Minister Announces Withdrawal from the Idea
description: There will be no 0 percent credit. The government's housing program will be presented in the first quarter of next year - announced on Thursday the Minister of Development and Technology Krzysztof Paszyk.

description: In Cyganówka (Mazowieckie) two cars collided. One person was injured. The road is blocked.

title: He had a machine gun in his car, and while running away he hit a policeman. There is a verdict
description: The District Court in Lublin sentenced a 31-year-old man to nine years in prison for running away and hitting a policeman. He had a machine gun and drugs in his car. The prosecutor's office accused him of attempted murder. However, the court ruled that he had only assaulted a policeman. The verdict is not final.

title: Security and Poland's EU presidency at the center of an important event

One of the most important events on the Polish congress map will return next year in a new version - the meeting place, in addition to the International Congress Centre, will also be Spodek.

title: We will buy "Sky Guardians" from the USA. They will be used to create a new type of army
description: The Polish sky will be safer. On Thursday, December 12, at the headquarters of the Ministry of National Defense, an agreement was signed for the purchase of MQ-9B Sky Guardian drones for the Polish Army. The agreement was concluded by the Armament Agency and the American company General Atomics. This will significantly increase Poland's (so far poor) reconnaissance and reconnaissance capabilities. But it will also be expensive.

title: What about compensation for Swiss franc borrowers? CJEU issues judgment on Getin
description: The EU Court did not rule on the illegality of the restructuring of Getin Noble Bank, and thus did not ensure that Swiss franc borrowers had the right to compensation from the State Treasury. However, the CJEU ruled that Polish courts may consider complaints from borrowers separately. Combining them into one case - although consistent with Polish law - would lead to excessive obstruction.

title: Citizens should know what protection the state guarantees them and what they must take care of themselves [INTERVIEW]
description: - The act is heading in the right direction, although of course the results depend on how it is implemented. The best regulations will not solve the problem if they are not supported by actions - says Bogusław Pacek, Maj. Gen. (retired), professor at the Institute of the Middle and Far East of the Jagiellonian University.

title: A new definition of mobbing is necessary, but risky
description: The Ministry of Family, Labor and Social Policy intends to introduce a new definition of mobbing. This is good, because the current one has many significant flaws that make it difficult for victims to pursue their claims.

title: Treasury bond sales fell. Current account balances began to dominate
description:
November brought a decline in retail sales of State Treasury bonds, although this year's result was still better than that of November
2023.

title: Musk richer than ever, astronomical valuation helped surpass $400 billion
description: The Bloomberg Billionaires Index has valued a single person's wealth at more than $400 billion for the first time in history. Elon Musk is strengthening his hold on the top of the list of the world's richest people, and billionaire wealth is growing at an unprecedented rate. Assets worth $100 billion are not enough to make the top ten.

title: Corporate governance research on the stock exchange. Take part
description: As the media patron of this important initiative, we turn to you with a request to participate in a study on corporate governance. This is an issue of key importance for the functioning of listed companies and, more broadly, the entire capital market.

title: More and more companies are suspended. One in seven is already suspending its operations
description: According to data from the Central Statistical Office, 28.6 thousand new companies were registered in the REGON system in November of this year. This is 11 percent less than in October and 4 percent less than a year ago. In addition, every seventh entrepreneur has already suspended their business.

title: Mercator wants to invest millions of zlotys in development activities
description: Mercator Medical wants to invest approximately PLN 150 million in development activities in 2025, CEO Monika Żyznowska said during a video conference.

title: The ECJ issued a judgment in the case of Getin Noble Bank and Swiss franc borrowers
description: The Court of Justice of the EU, in its judgment issued on Thursday concerning Getin Noble Bank, ruled that the national court should examine not only the complaint of the supervisory board of that bank against its compulsory restructuring, but also over 8,000 other complaints, filed, among others, by Swiss franc borrowers.

title: Poland to Build Drone Units. Defense Minister: It's an Absolute Priority
description: The construction of drone troops is an absolute priority for us - emphasized Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, after the agreement for the purchase of MQ-9B Sky Guardian drones for the Polish Army was concluded on Thursday.

title: Citi Handlowy's Chief Economist: Deficit May Be Higher, But Inflation Shouldn't Surprise
description: Slower growth in nominal GDP and the amendment to the budget act for 2024 suggest that the sector deficit in 2025 may be higher than the Ministry of Finance assumes and reach 6.1% of GDP, assessed Piotr Kalisz, Chief Economist of Citi Handlowy, in an interview with PAP Biznes. Fiscal tightening in Poland will probably not occur until 2026.

title: NIK: Irregularities in the sale of real estate at PGE Dystrybucja
description: The Supreme Audit Office has uncovered irregularities in the sale of real estate in the Warsaw branch of PGE Dystrybucja. The sale of real estate in Ostrołęka for PLN 485,000 raised the most concerns, NIK reported on Thursday.

title: Gold still in fashion. PIE analysts: Demand will be high
description: Demand for gold will be high - say analysts from the Polish Economic Institute.

title: Uniformed services unions want 15% pay rises. Ministry of Interior and Administration: it's hard to achieve
description: The unions of uniformed services have decided to start a protest. They are demanding, among other things, a 15% pay rise and a housing allowance similar to that in the Polish Armed Forces. Deputy Minister of Interior and Administration Wiesław Szczepański assured that the ministry wants to talk about the demands, but the provisions for a 5% pay rise have already been accepted.

title: GDP will accelerate. Deloittle: Poland will be the growth leader in Central Europe until 2026
description: Poland will be the leader in economic growth in Central Europe by 2026, with a projected GDP growth of over 3 percent, according to Deloitte's "CE Economic Outlook Autumn 2024" report. It was reported that thanks to a diversified economy and a large domestic market, as well as an expansionary fiscal policy, Poland is currently in a better situation than the rest of Central Europe.

title: TVP wants a new agreement with the Polish Episcopal Conference. Until now, it has spent a fortune on Catholic broadcasts
description: Telewizja Polska has expressed its readiness to co-create and sign a new agreement with representatives of the Polish Episcopal Conference, which would be based on realistic assumptions and financial possibilities - the TVP press office informed PAP.

title: The Church opposes the reduction of religious education classes. Nowacka: It has no right to veto
description: The MEN regulation on the organization of religious education classes must come into effect, said the Minister of Education, Barbara Nowacka, on Thursday. She emphasized that the Church does not have the right to veto the government's regulations and functioning.

title: Podcast "The Thing Is": There Will Be No 0% Loans. Chaos in Housing Policy Deepens
description: Minister of Development Krzysztof Paszyk announced on Thursday morning that the government will not introduce 0% credit. Is this the end of the coalition's great promises? How is Donald Tusk's government doing in housing policy? Was it a wasted year? On the eve of the anniversary of the establishment of the government, Adam Roguski sums up the achievements of Donald Tusk's cabinet in the podcast "Rzecz w tym".

title: The son of the NIK president faces new charges for bank fraud
description: Jakub Banaś and his wife have heard new charges in the investigation into irregularities in the asset declarations of the president of the Supreme Audit Office, Marian Banaś, “Rzeczpospolita” has learned.

title: A breakthrough judgment of the European Court of Justice. It concerns Getin Noble Bank and Swiss franc borrowers
description: The Court of Justice of the EU in its Thursday judgment concerning Getin Noble Bank ruled that the national court is obliged to consider not only the complaint filed by the bank's supervisory board against the decision on compulsory restructuring, but also over 8,000 other complaints, including those filed by Swiss franc borrowers.

title: Darek Stolarz is moving to the competition. This is what Dorota Szelągowska says
description: This is a surprising transfer. Dariusz Wardziak, known to viewers as "Darek Stolarz" from Dorota Szelągowska's programs broadcast on TVN, is moving to the competition, Polsat. He will join the "Nasz nowy dom" format, hosted by Elżbieta Romanowska. Dorota Szelągowska, commenting on the matter, admitted that she had known about it for a long time.

title: Billion-plus in revenues: Beloved comedy returns after 15 years
description: The Meet the Parents trilogy is already a classic of modern comedy. The films have grossed well over a billion dollars in cinemas worldwide and have millions of fans, including in Poland. News has just broken that will surely make them happy - work is underway on the fourth installment of the cult series with Ben Stiller and Robert De Niro.

title: These seniors gave up their apartments in exchange for a lifetime annuity. How much do they get per month?
description: A growing number of Polish seniors are deciding to sell their properties to mortgage funds in exchange for a lifetime annuity. The total value of these properties has already reached PLN 150 million, but the amount of pension benefits received remains relatively low. What exactly? Here are the details.

title: Lewandowski razed to the ground. There's a lot of buzz in Spain. "Without instinct
description: It was not a successful return for Robert Lewandowski to Signal Iduna Park. The Polish striker did not shine in the Champions League match between Borussia Dortmund and FC Barcelona (2:3). The worse form of the 36-year-old was also noticed by the Spanish media. According to them, Lewandowski was one of the worst players on the pitch.

title: Up to PLN 6,924.12 for parents. What conditions must be met to benefit from the relief?
description: Did you know that by raising a child you can significantly reduce your tax? Thanks to the child tax relief, families in Poland have the opportunity to receive a refund of up to PLN 6,924.12 per year. Check who can benefit from this support, what the rules are and how to do it step by step.

title: What's happening with Beata Kozidrak? There is new information about her health
description: A few days ago, Beata Kozidrak posted a statement online in which she wrote that due to health problems, she was canceling concerts planned for the coming months. According to people close to her, the situation is "serious". A source from the Świat Gwiazd portal revealed what was the reason for the hospitalization.

title: How well do you know Polish proverbs? Easy quiz. You should be lucky
description: Test yourself in this quiz with popular, but also lesser-known Polish proverbs. What they have in common is that they all concern happiness. Your task will be to fill in the missing word in the given sentences. Will you manage to get a complete set? Good luck!

title: Do you want a higher pension? And from next month? Just this one thing is enough
description: ZUS informs that some retirees may be entitled to a higher pension. The reason may be the lack of providing all the necessary documents, especially those from the period before 1999. If we complete the documentation, ZUS will recalculate the benefit and possibly increase its amount. Here are the details.

title: 250 million wasn't enough. Cinema blockbuster after a month on VOD
description: Can you make $250 million and fail spectacularly? If you spent $350 million first, then by all means. That's exactly what happened to the Hollywood Christmas blockbuster "The Red One." The stars in the cast didn't help. The film made $100 million less in theaters than its budget, which is why it was rushed to VOD today, December 12, barely a month after its theatrical premiere.

title: Gold prices skyrocket as geopolitical storms fuel demand for precious metal
description: Gold, as a key strategic asset, is playing an increasingly important role in the global economy, especially in times of growing geopolitical tensions and uncertainty on financial markets. As the Polish Economic Institute (PIE) notes, the growing interest in this precious metal results from a number of factors that influence the decisions of central banks and institutional investors.

title: Important decision by the prosecutor's office in the Mbappe case. It concerns the investigation in connection with the alleged rape
description: Kylian Mbappe can now breathe a sigh of relief and sleep soundly. Due to insufficient evidence, Swedish prosecutors have dropped the investigation into the French footballer for alleged rape and sexual assault during his October visit to Stockholm.

title: Macron met with Tusk. Later talks with the president
description: At 3 p.m. there will be a meeting between the presidents of Poland and France.

description: Anna Bryłka spoke, among other things, about the fact that the Supreme Court upheld the complaint of Law and Justice against the decision of the National Electoral Commission regarding the subsidy.

title: There are no on-duty pharmacies. Many counties have not adopted resolutions
description: After almost a year of the regulations providing for paying pharmacies for on-duty shifts being in force, almost half of the counties authorized to do so have still not adopted the required resolutions.

title: 17-year-old scientist Kornelia Wieczorek: I respond to the needs and problems I see
description: We should never demotivate young people who want to act, because they have enormous power, says high school student Kornelia Wieczorek, winner of the "Young Inventor" competition organized by "Rzeczpospolita" and the Patent Office.

title: Australians may sentence 10-year-olds to life in prison
description: The Australian state of Queensland has passed legislation under which children as young as 10 will be exposed to the same penalties as adults for committing the most serious crimes, such as murder, but also assault or burglary.

title: Message from Pope Francis: “Transfer your weapons spending to fight hunger”
description: Pope Francis, in a message related to the Holy Year of the Roman Catholic Church, drew attention to problems that "pose a threat to the existence of humanity." These, in his opinion, are global climate change, wars and unequal treatment of migrants. The Pope called for countries to "transfer spending on weapons and military equipment to the fight against hunger in the world.

title: Trucks Without Borders in Bulgaria and Romania
description: The abolition of controls on the Bulgarian and Romanian borders will be a boost for trade. Polish companies also have an appetite for increasing turnover.

title: Scandinavian Airlines Returns to Wrocław
description: The largest carrier in the Nordic countries, Scandinavian Airlines, will once again fly from Wrocław Airport after a break of several years.

title: Ruslan Shoshin: Nuclear weapons in Belarus are a problem for Alexander Lukashenko, not for Poland
description: Paranoia and the desire to maintain power. These are the real reasons why Alexander Lukashenko is in such a hurry to deploy the latest Russian nuclear weapons in his country. And the Belarusian dictator is becoming its hostage.

title: ZUS reported difficulties. Access problems as early as December 13
description: People using ZUS electronic services should expect major disruptions in the near future. Access to the portal and application will be limited. The reason is service work that will begin on December 13.

title: Battery Prices at Record Lows. Will Electric Cars Be Cheaper?
description: Lithium-ion cell prices are plummeting. But will this translate into lower prices for electric cars? In the future, for sure, but for now, companies want to recoup their investment.

title: ‘The Greatest Act of Grace in a Single Day.’ Joe Biden’s Surprise Move
description: Outgoing US President Joe Biden has used his discretion to commute the sentences of 1,500 people serving time under house arrest. He has also pardoned 39 people convicted of nonviolent crimes, AP reported. The president said he will continue reviewing the clemency petitions in the coming weeks. It is the largest such act of clemency granted in a single day, the agency noted.

title: Matura 2025: When are the written and oral exams? Key dates, schedule
description: The 2025 Matura exam will be held from May 5 to 24. It will begin as usual at 9:00 AM with a written exam in Polish. Graduates will have to wait until July 8 for the results of all exams.

title: The Savior's 30 Minutes: An Important Discovery About the Impact of Physical Activity on Memory
description: Just 30 minutes of exercise is enough to improve memory and cognitive functions for the next 24 hours. It does not have to be a typical workout. Even a brisk walk will be appropriate. British scientists have reached such conclusions based on the conducted research.

title: New cable car and new routes in the Bachledka ski resort in Slovakia
description: This winter season, a new, six-person covered cable car will be launched at the Slovak ski resort Bachledka Ski & Sun.

title: Austria ends Gazprom. Terminates contract valid until 2040
description: Austrian energy company OMV has terminated its long-term contract with Gazprom with immediate effect, citing Russia's breach of contract.

title: Obesity in pregnant women with hormonal disorders has a significant impact on the child's health. Research results
description: Based on a new study, Norwegian scientists have determined that hormonal disorders combined with obesity in women can negatively affect the health of their children. This applies to both the newborn's body parameters and the child's further development.

title: Musk Challenges China: Cheap Tesla Coming in 2025
description: Tesla Model Y will get a younger brother. Elon Musk wants to launch the Model Q, which is to be about four meters long and appear on the market in 2025 for about PLN 100,000.

title: She drove into a school crossing with a bang. 38-year-old with a record number of penalty points
description: The 38-year-old received a single 47 penalty points for driving with force onto a pedestrian crossing at a school and failing to yield. - The woman showed no remorse, claiming that nothing happened to anyone - said Patryk Domarecki from the Otwock police station. The police filed a motion to the court for a check of the driver's qualifications.

title: Olaf Scholz wants to talk to Putin again. "I'll do it again
description: Olaf Scholz has declared that he will make another attempt at negotiations with Vladimir Putin. The German Chancellor spoke to the Russian president in November for the first time in almost two years. He said that the conversation was frustrating but necessary and that is why he intends to try again.

title: Miracle in the Mediterranean: 11-year-old survives storm and waits for help for three days
description: A girl from Sierra Leone has emerged as the sole survivor of 44 people aboard a boat that sank off the coast of Lampedusa, Italy. All other passengers are listed as missing and presumed dead. The 11-year-old only survived because she was adrift for three days, clinging to a car inner tube.

Is Romanowski hiding? "I will not answer any questions regarding his whereabouts," attorney Bartosz Lewandowski told RMF FM.

title: Investigation into irregularities in the "Work for Prisoners" program

title: Macron in Warsaw. Military mission in Ukraine on the agenda?
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is arriving in Warsaw, where he will meet with Donald Tusk and Andrzej Duda. Observers in France emphasize that Macron's visit may have multidimensional significance. On the one hand, it may be about tightening cooperation with Poland in the context of talks on the EU-Mercosur agreement. On the other hand, there is information that the meeting with Polish authorities will discuss the possible sending of stabilization peacekeeping forces to Ukraine.

title: HUR was supposed to eliminate Russia's leading rocket engineer
description: Mikhail Shatsky was found dead in Moscow. He was a key figure in the Russian arms industry and served as deputy director general of the Russian Mars design bureau, responsible for, among other things, the design of rockets and drones. Ukrainian media report that Shatsky was eliminated by Kiev's agents.

title: Nawrocki appealed to Trzaskowski. It's about one signature

The security of Poles should be the demarcation line of the political dispute - he emphasized. Nawrocki and Trzaskowski are candidates in the presidential elections.

description: DNA test results confirmed that the body of a 53-year-old from Siedlce, suspected of shooting his wife, was in the burnt-out car wreck. A large-scale search for the man was conducted after the body of a woman with gunshot wounds was found in the yard.

description: The driver of the Mercedes had 2.2 per mille of alcohol in his system. The man was stopped by the police in Gorzyce (Podkarpackie) because he exceeded the speed limit by 78 kilometers per hour.

title: When you see this squirrel, you will burst into loud laughter
description: A photo of a squirrel "trapped" in a tree hole won the tenth edition of the international Comedy Wildlife Photo Award competition. Nine thousand photographs competed for the main prize.

title: Brits investigate Shein amid allegations of slave labor
description: Britain’s financial watchdog is delaying approval of Shein’s initial public offering, Reuters reports. Two sources told Reuters that oversight of the online marketplace’s supply chain is being reviewed, and legal risks associated with the listing are being assessed after protests by Uighur rights groups, an ethnic minority in China who may be subject to forced labor.

title: Polar vortex could cause snow on New Year's Eve and New Year's Day
description: What will the weather be like on Christmas? The closer to Christmas, the more often forecasters look into the calculations of meteorological models. The latest forecasts show that winter with snow will come, but only on New Year's Eve and New Year's Day.

description: Judge Paweł Juszczyszyn will receive compensation for his salary, which was reduced by 40 percent by the illegal Disciplinary Chamber of the Supreme Court - reports OKO.Press. "The verdict is not final, but it may quickly become final because no one will appeal it," the portal adds.

title: Hołownia on "absurd" words in Romanowski's case. "This means anarchy

The prosecutor's office received a motion to issue an arrest warrant for Romanowski.

title: Without knowing Spanish, he became a Spanish Scrabble champion. "It's like playing against a computer
description: Nigel Richards has become the world champion of Spanish Scrabble. His achievement is all the more impressive because the New Zealander doesn't speak the language. The 57-year-old only learned how to spell the Spanish words, not what they mean.

title: Actress' Husband Jumped Into Icy Pool, Dies
description: British actress Carol Royle took to social media to announce the tragic death of her husband, Julian Spear. He died after jumping into a pool of icy water.

title: He ignored the stop sign and drove under the railbus
description: A 44-year-old woman was injured in an accident in Krosno (Podkarpackie). The driver of a passenger car ignored a stop sign and drove onto a level crossing under a railbus.

description: Tragedy at one of the climbing walls in Wrocław. A 38-year-old man died. The prosecutor is conducting an investigation into the accidental death.

title: It was known that this investment was simply and simply absurd.
description: Okay. Except that of course it is incredibly late - this is how Piotr Woźniak, former Minister of Economy and former head of the Polish Oil and Gas Company, commented on the decision of the Orlen board to suspend the Olefin III project on TVN24. At the same time, he sharply summed up the company's plans to continue the project. From now on, the work will be carried out as part of the New Chemistry project.

title: Humiliating blow" to Kadyrov. Drones over Grozny
description: Drones attacked the barracks of a special regiment of the Interior Ministry in Grozny, the capital of Chechnya, media reported on Thursday. Chechen leader and close ally of Vladimir Putin, Ramzan Kadyrov, vowed retaliation. A Ukrainian official said it was a "humiliating blow," but Kiev did not take responsibility for the attack.

title: The number of infections is increasing every year. WHO has provided data
description: The number of recorded cases of malaria has been growing continuously for five years, according to the latest report by the World Health Organization, which concerned 2023. In this period alone, the disease spread by mosquitoes killed 600,000 people. The WHO draws attention to the growing problems related to the increasing resistance to drugs and climate change, which make it difficult to control infection hotspots.

title: It was supposed to be sold, after the occupation there was a promise from the minister. The university has a plan for a dormitory
description: The competition for the implementation project for the reconstruction and possible expansion of the inactive Jowita student residence hall in the center of Poznań is to be decided in the second half of next year, Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań announced on Thursday.

title: Tesla Hits Record Stock Valuations Thanks to Trump
description: Tesla shares rose to an all-time high on Wednesday, surpassing their previous record set in 2021. The record high comes as Wall Street's enthusiasm for Elon Musk's electric vehicle company grows following the election of Donald Trump as US president, CNBC reports.

title: Kosiniak-Kamysz: I announced the creation of drone troops. It is becoming a fact
description: A few months ago I announced the creation of drone forces. This is becoming a fact. From January 1, drone forces will operate not as a plan, but as a real part of the Polish Army - declared Minister of Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz. MQ-9B SkyGuardian drones are to be delivered to Poland by the first quarter of 2027.

title: Large unannounced maneuvers. Some ships approached the island
description: Sixteen Chinese ships and 34 military aircraft have been detected around Taiwan, the Taiwanese Defense Ministry said on Thursday. It said these were the largest forces to appear near the island in months. At the same time, massive, unannounced maneuvers are currently underway along all of China's coastlines, with nearly 90 naval and coast guard units expected to participate.

title: 14-year-old Natalia was dying in the center of Andrychów. Investigators have revealed the cause of death
description: The death of 14-year-old Natalia was of interest to all of Poland. The girl died for several hours outside a shop in the center of Andrychów, she was taken to hospital, but her life could not be saved. Right after the tragedy, the initial cause of death was given as cerebral edema caused by a hematoma. Now, however, experts indicate that the girl had hypothermia.

title: He molested and got a student drunk, showed him pornography. Final verdict for priest
description: The District Court in Ostrołęka upheld the verdict of the District Court in Wyszków, which sentenced Father Łukasz R. to six years in prison. The vicar was accused of sexual offences against a boy under 15.

title: Garbage truck flew into the air. Explosion on video
description: Two police officers and a firefighter were injured when a garbage truck exploded in a Chicago suburb, local police said. Authorities are investigating the cause of the explosion and have released video of the incident.

title: Christmas shopping almost 5 percent more expensive. Which stores are the cheapest?

During the year, Christmas shopping prices increased the most in the Lidl, Aldi and Biedronka chains, while it is cheaper in Dino and Makro Cash & Carry. Orange juice and milk chocolate have increased the most.

She called her father, telling him what was happening, but she was unable to specify where she was. After that, she did not answer.

title: Such a situation is mobbing". A petition regarding teachers' working hours was submitted to the Ministry of National Education
description: A petition has been submitted to the Ministry of National Education, the author of which is demanding changes to the Teachers' Charter that would guarantee teachers an eight-hour workday. As he points out, the current regulations allow for unlimited daily working hours, which, given the possibility of establishing "windows", leaves room for abuse.

title: Donald Tusk after meeting with Emmanuel Macron: Voters will choose presidents, not Putin
description: We talked about the threat of Russian interference in our democratic processes, thank you for your understanding, we share the same view. In Poland and France, voters will elect presidents, not the Kremlin and not Putin - said Prime Minister Donald Tusk after the meeting with Emmanuel Macron.

title: Prosecutor's Office files charges against Moroccan man who stabbed 32-year-old Pole

title: New holidays in 2025. How to use the extra 7 days?
description: Marta Kawczyńska on the Zdrowiego.pl portal presents details about the new type of leave that employees are entitled to in 2025. These are additional days off that can be taken independently of vacation leave. They were introduced under the amendment to the Labor Code in April 2023, and Poles can use them for the third time.

title: Putin's Hidden Daughter Lives in Paris Using Two Surnames
description: Vladimir Putin closely guards his privacy, and the truth about the number of his descendants is probably known only to him. Officially, the Russian president has two daughters – Maria and Katerina. A few years ago, thanks to a journalistic investigation, the world learned about the third "alleged Putin daughter". 21-year-old Elizaveta Krivonogikh now lives in Paris and uses two surnames.

title: Attack in Moscow. Media: Ukrainian military intelligence is behind the operation
description: Mikhail Shatsky, deputy chief designer of the Mars Design Bureau, which, among other things, modernizes cruise missiles used to attack Ukraine, was killed in Moscow. According to reports, Ukrainian military intelligence (HUR) was behind the attack.

title: Important announcement from ZUS. These parents will have to return the money from the benefit
description: Cash benefits paid regularly by the Social Insurance Institution provide significant support for Polish families. The recently introduced "grandmother's" program has additionally increased the financial burden on ZUS. However, some beneficiaries may be required to return the funds received. Why? Here are the details.

title: Do not add it to herring under any circumstances. It will turn out bitter and should be thrown away.
description: Herring is a classic of Polish cuisine, which many fans have, especially during Christmas. Preparing herring seems easy, but it is not always successful. The reason is mistakes in preparing herring, which cause the fish to come out bitter, too hard or too soft, in other words, simply unpalatable. How to make perfect herring, and above all, what to avoid?

title: The biggest streaming hits of 2024. The popular VOD platform has released a list
description: Among the most watched programs in the Max platform ranking were the best series of the passing year, such as "Penguin" or "Stamtąd". The strong point of the offer was also Polish documentaries, series and films. The list also includes all productions whose action takes place in the Dune universe.

title: Biology and nature QUIZ. Check how much you know about the world around you. Will you get a full set of points?
description: Do you have a moment to take a break? If so, we invite you to take part in a short and very interesting biology and nature quiz. Do you know what kind of animal the silkworm is? Which of the following trees grows the fastest? In which regions is the temperature difference between day and night the highest? You will be able to answer these and other questions in our quiz. This is a great opportunity to check how much you know. Good luck!

title: Transferring Cash from Parents. When Do You Have to Pay Tax?
description: Have you received a gift from close family or distant relatives? Check what steps you need to take to settle the gift tax. Below we present all the most important information.

title: Prestigious position for Morawiecki. Unofficial information
description: According to the Italian newspaper Il Giornale, Mateusz Morawiecki will take office as the leader of the European Conservatives and Reformists party in a few weeks. This is the most important party in the European Union, bringing together right-wing groups.

title: Tusk: We do not plan to have troops in Ukraine after the ceasefire
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk, who met with French President Emmanuel Macron in Warsaw, assured that Poland does not plan to have troops in Ukraine after a ceasefire is reached in that country.

title: She got 47 penalty points! She sped in front of the school without a seatbelt
description: The Otwock police received a report from the principal of one of the schools about a Skoda driver who, ignoring the instructions of the person directing traffic, the so-called stopka, not only failed to give way to pedestrians, but also drove onto a pedestrian crossing with great force.

title: Uniformed officers want 15 percent pay rises. Ministry of Interior and Administration: They want to force us
description: In recent days, several trade unions of the uniformed services subordinate to the Ministry of Interior and Administration have announced protest action or their readiness to start it.

title: Romania and Bulgaria will join the "full Schengen
description: EU interior ministers decided in Brussels to abolish traveller checks at land borders with Bulgaria and Romania from 1 January 2025.

title: On Tusk the hat is burning
PiS politicians appeal: Let's take up a resolution on the mines
description: Law and Justice politicians appealed to the Speaker of the Sejm Szymon Hołownia to "unfreeze" the draft resolution obliging the government to withdraw from the Ottawa Treaty regarding the ban on the use of anti-personnel mines.

title: Morawiecki's European success. He is to become the head of ECR
description: According to "Il Giornale", Prime Minister Meloni is to announce the decision on this matter at the ECR summit in Atreu in a few days, while the formal election of Morawiecki as the new leader of the party is to take place in January.

title: ECB cuts deposit rate again. Fourth time in 2024
description: The European Central Bank cut its deposit rate (currently treated as the main rate) by 25 basis points, to 3 percent. This was in line with analysts' forecasts.

title: Polish soldiers in Ukraine? Radosław Sikorski's unequivocal declaration
description: - Nothing concerning Ukraine should take place without Ukraine and Europe - said Minister Radosław Sikorski during the meeting of the heads of the Foreign Ministry of Germany, Poland, France, Italy, Spain and Great Britain in Berlin. The head of European diplomacy, Kaja Kallas, is also in the German capital.

title: Former deputy minister in the PiS government Marcin Romanowski wanted on an arrest warrant
description: The prosecutor's office issued an arrest warrant for Marcin Romanowski on Thursday. The former deputy minister in the PiS government is to be held for three months. He is a suspect in an investigation into irregularities in the Justice Fund.

title: Complaints about Getin Bank restructuring. Important verdict for Swiss franc borrowers
description: The CJEU ruled that the consideration of complaints by Swiss franc borrowers must take place within a reasonable time and take into account individual allegations.

title: It is known who replaced Ewa Wrzosek
description: Prosecutor General Adam Bodnar has appointed a new member of the National Council of Prosecutors. Ewa Wrzosek, dismissed on Wednesday, will be replaced by prosecutor Justyna Brzozowska.

title: The French will "contribute" to the construction of a nuclear power plant in Poland
description: Polish Nuclear Power Plants are finalizing debt financing for the first nuclear power plant in Choczewo. In addition to the Americans and Canadians, the French will also lend money to build a nuclear power plant.

title: Fewer and fewer available accommodations for Christmas and New Year's Eve. "The most expensive offers are left in the mountains
description: During the upcoming holidays and New Year's Eve, as every year, most tourists will be resting in the mountains, where the number of available rooms is decreasing day by day. Cities organizing TV New Year's Eve parties are also very popular - according to the analysis by Nocowanie.pl.

title: Barbrich: Christmas will be more expensive than last year
description: How much will Poles spend on Christmas this year? What expenses will take up the largest part of our budget? What to watch out for when shopping online? We considered this in the program Rzecz o Biznesie. Przemysław Tychmanowicz's guest was Przemysław Barbrich, director of the communication and PR team at the Polish Bank Association.

title: TUI improved its financial results in 2024. It is forecasting even better results for the new year.
description: Operating profit up 33 percent year-on-year, and revenue up 12 percent – ​​TUI Group summed up the financial year ended September 30. The company announces that these indicators will increase next year.

title: You can avoid tax on Christmas gifts. Ministry of Finance explains
description: If the gift is from a company social benefits fund, the employee is entitled to a PIT exemption. If it is a donation, he or she can use the amount free from inheritance and donation tax.

title: Changes to VAT on investment silver. The Ministry speaks out
description: From 1 January 2025, the rules for VAT taxation of works of art, collectibles and antiques will change. The taxation of silver coins that are collectibles has stirred controversy. According to commentators, the new regulations will decimate the Polish investment silver market.

title: Iwona Gębusia: Polsat and TVN – media or strategic service providers?
description: It is highly risky to include Polsat and TVN in the list of Poland's strategic companies based on the regulation due to their secondary telecommunications activity, and not their primary media (audiovisual) activity.

title: 16-year-old scientist Kornelia Wieczorek: I respond to the needs and problems I see
description: We should never demotivate young people who want to act, because they have enormous power, says high school student Kornelia Wieczorek, winner of the "Young Inventor" competition organized by "Rzeczpospolita" and the Patent Office.

title: 68-year-old dressed up as a female homeowner, tried to sell the property
description: The 68-year-old was arrested for impersonating the owner of an apartment and trying to sell her property. The man showed up at the meeting dressed as a woman, which aroused the suspicion of the real estate agent, who called the police. Officers found fake IDs in the fraudster's apartment, as well as wigs and women's clothing.

title: The Unexpected Return of an Extinct Species: Black Insect Spotted in Poland
description: Albert Einstein is credited with saying: If the bee dies out, the human race will have only 4 years left. This is not entirely true, because many plants do not require pollination, and others are satisfied with the remaining pollinating insects. Nevertheless, the ecosystem would certainly suffer greatly. It is no wonder that the appearance of new habitats of the black bee species in Poland arouses such enthusiasm.

title: Marcin Romanowski's wanted list. Prosecutor's decision
description: The prosecutor's office issued an arrest warrant for PiS MP Marcin Romanowski, confirming earlier findings by Polsat News. The prosecutor reported that the suspect had turned off his phones and had not logged on to the network since December 6. The former Minister of Justice is wanted by the police in order to arrest and bring to custody.

title: An election promise that divided coalition partners. There will be no 0% credit.
description: It was supposed to be one of the fulfilled election promises, but there was no agreement on it among the coalition partners themselves. Now it looks like the 0% loan has finally fallen through, as confirmed by Minister Krzysztof Paszyk. Instead, a completely new solution is to appear soon. And although no details have been provided, its processing is to begin in the first quarter of 2025.
